author: Syed Muthahar Saqaf
text:
The successful staging of the drama ‘Pavalakodi’ in Salem city has emboldened the Department of Art and Culture to stage the play in the other major cities and towns in the State.

This will be done with the objective of reviving the theatre art in the rural towns and also the plays authored and directed by Sankaradas Swamigal, said B. Hemanathan, Regional Assistant Director of Art and Culture. He said that the dramas such as “Harichandra”, “Valli Tirumanam”, “Sathiyavan Savithri”, “Bama Vijayam” along with “Pavalakodi” have always remained favourites of all sections of art lovers of the State. Many theatre artistes who acted in these dramas, later won name and fame in cinema. For various reasons, the plays of Sankaradas Swamigal have almost been forgotten by the present generation. The younger generation is not aware of Swamigal’s personality and his great works.
title: Play to be staged in other cities
